io.nats.client

Interface Connection


  • public interface Connection
    A Connection object is a client's active connection to NATS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • publish

        void publish(String subject,
             byte[] data)
        Publishes the payload specified by data to the subject specified by subject
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the message to
        data - the message payload

      • publish

        void publish(Message msg)
        Publishes a message to a subject. The subject is set via Message.setSubject(String) or the Message.Message(String, String, byte[]) constructor.
        Parameters:
        msg - the Message to publish

      • publish

        void publish(String subject,
             String reply,
             byte[] data)
        Publishes the payload specified by data to the subject specified by subject, with an option reply subject. If reply is null, the behavior is identical to publish(String, byte[])
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the message to
        reply - the subject to which subscribers should send responses
        data - the message payload

      • request

        Message request(String subject,
                byte[] data,
                long timeout)
         throws TimeoutException,
                IOException
        Publishes a request message to the specified subject, waiting up to timeout msec for a response.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the request message to
        data - the request message payload
        timeout - how long to wait for a response message (in msec)
        Returns:
        the response message
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error occurs
        TimeoutException - if timeout elapses before a message is returned

      • request

        Message request(String subject,
                byte[] data)
         throws TimeoutException,
                IOException
        Publishes a request message to the specified subject, waiting for a response until one is available.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the request message to
        data - the message payload
        Returns:
        the response message
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error occurs
        TimeoutException - if timeout elapses before a message is returned

      • subscribe

        AsyncSubscription subscribe(String subject,
                            MessageHandler cb)
        Creates a AsyncSubscription with interest in a given subject, assign the callback, and immediately start receiving messages
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        cb - a MessageHandler object used to process messages received by the AsyncSubscription
        Returns:
        the started AsyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject (or queue) name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribeAsync

        AsyncSubscription subscribeAsync(String subject,
                                 MessageHandler cb)
        Creates a AsyncSubscription with interest in a given subject, assign the callback, and immediately start receiving messages
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        cb - a MessageHandler object used to process messages received by the AsyncSubscription
        Returns:
        the started AsyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject (or queue) name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribeSync

        SyncSubscription subscribeSync(String subject,
                               String queue)
        Creates a synchronous queue subscriber on a given subject of interest. All subscribers with the same queue name will form the queue group and only one member of the group will be selected to receive any given message. MessageHandler must be registered, and AsyncSubscription.start() must be called.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        queue - the queue group
        Returns:
        the SyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject (or queue) name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribeAsync

        AsyncSubscription subscribeAsync(String subject,
                                 String queue)
        Creates an asynchronous queue subscriber on a given subject of interest. All subscribers with the same queue name will form the queue group and only one member of the group will be selected to receive any given message. In order to receive messages, a MessageHandler must be registered, and AsyncSubscription.start() must be called.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        queue - the name of the queue group
        Returns:
        the Subscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject (or queue) name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribe

        Subscription subscribe(String subject,
                       String queue,
                       MessageHandler cb)
        Creates an asynchronous queue subscriber on a given subject of interest. All subscribers with the same queue name will form the queue group and only one member of the group will be selected to receive any given message asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        queue - the name of the queue group
        cb - a MessageHandler object used to process messages received by the Subscription
        Returns:
        Subscription

      • subscribeAsync

        AsyncSubscription subscribeAsync(String subject,
                                 String queue,
                                 MessageHandler cb)
        Create an AsyncSubscription with interest in a given subject, assign the message callback, and immediately start receiving messages.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        queue - the name of the queue group
        cb - a message callback for this subscription
        Returns:
        the AsyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject (or queue) name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribeAsync

        AsyncSubscription subscribeAsync(String subject)
        Creates a AsyncSubscription with interest in a given subject. In order to receive messages, a MessageHandler must be registered, and AsyncSubscription.start() must be called.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        Returns:
        the AsyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • subscribeSync

        SyncSubscription subscribeSync(String subject)
        Creates a AsyncSubscription with interest in a given subject. In order to receive messages, a MessageHandler must be registered, and AsyncSubscription.start() must be called.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of interest
        Returns:
        the AsyncSubscription
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the subject name contains illegal characters.
        NullPointerException - if the subject name is null
        IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed

      • newInbox

        String newInbox()
        Creates a new, uniquely named inbox with the prefix '_INBOX.'
        Returns:
        the newly created inbox subject

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the connection, also closing all subscriptions on this connection.

        When close() is called, the following things happen, in order:

        1. The Connection is flushed, and any other pending flushes previously requested by the user are immediately cleared.
        2. Message delivery to all active subscriptions is terminated immediately, without regard to any messages that may have been delivered to the client's connection, but not to the relevant subscription(s). Any such undelivered messages are discarded immediately.
        3. The DisconnectedCallback, if registered, is invoked.
        4. The ClosedCallback, if registered, is invoked.
        5. The TCP/IP socket connection to the NATS server is gracefully closed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        See Also:
        AutoCloseable.close()

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Indicates whether the connection has been closed.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is closed.

      • isReconnecting

        boolean isReconnecting()
        Indicates whether the connection is currently reconnecting.
        Returns:
        whether or not the connection is currently reconnecting

      • getMaxPayload

      • flush

        void flush(int timeout)
    throws IOException,
           TimeoutException,
           Exception
        Flushes the current connection, waiting up to timeout for successful completion.
        Parameters:
        timeout - - the connection timeout in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error prevents the flush from completing
        TimeoutException - if the connection does not complete within the specified interval
        Exception - if some other error occurs

      • flush

        void flush()
    throws IOException,
           Exception
        Flushes the current connection, waiting up to 60 seconds for completion.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related issue prevented the flush from completing successfully
        Exception - if some other error is encountered
        See Also:
        flush(int)
